brief_summary.textblock:
Untreated ankle sprains often remain symptomatic and may end in chronic instability. The aim
      of our study is to quantify the stabilizing effect of different devices. Through the use of
      a foot measurement model in 3D motion analysis the influence of the devices with respect to
      a mechanical effect is examined by means of different tests. The dynamic postural control is
      quantified.  The hypothesis was that the devices would stabilize differently the foot
      segments.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  chronic ankle instability

          -  "giving way"

          -  repeated ankle sprains

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  other injuries of the lower extremities

          -  surgery on the lower extremities

intervention.intervention_name: Applying ankle support device (white non-elastic tape, kinesiotape (TM), soft brace (Malleotrain TM)

facility.name: Department of Orthopedics, Trauma Surgery and Spinal Cord Injury, Heidelberg University Hospital

overall_official.affiliation: Dep. of Orthopedics, Trauma Surgery and Spinal Cord Injury

primary_outcome.measure: change of the range of motion of the subtalar inversion/eversion in degree
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline (=before) and immediately after applying the device

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Principal Investigator, Job Title: Orthopedic and Trauma Surgeon

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
